title: Business live: 22 May 2015 - BBC News
summary: government borrowing falls to £ 6.8bn in april .
alison brittain becomes whitbread chief executive .

documents.title: over and out
text: that 's all we have time for on business live for friday - thanks for reading .
we are back at 0700 on monday so do join us then .

documents.title: california farmers offer water cuts
text: california regulators have accepted a historic offer by farmers to make a 25 % voluntary water cut to avoid deeper mandatory losses during the state 's ongoing drought .

several hundred farmers in the delta of the sacramento and san joaquin rivers , who hold some of california 's strongest water rights , made the offer after state officials warned they would soon order some of the first cuts in more than 30 years to the water rights holders .

documents.title: wall street ends down
text: wall street closed lower after federal reserve chair janet yellen said the central bank was still set to

documents.title: starbucks whistleblower
text: a hacker who reported a security hole in starbucks ' website has criticised the company 's handling of the matter .

documents.title: secret bank of england brexit project revealed
text: secret bank of england brexit project revealed

documents.title: scrabble gets hip
text: whatever next ?
some 6,500 new words have been added to the collins official scrabble wordlist - including down-with-the-kids terms such as lolz , shizzle and twerking .
it appears to be a bid to attract younger players to a board game that is now more than six decades old .

john chew , co-president of the north american scrabble players association , said the new collins list will `` bring in new players who would otherwise not want to play the game because some of their favourite everyday words were not acceptable until this year '' .
i am not so sure .
lolz .

documents.title: tokyo economic storm warning
text: japan must take `` bold action '' in order to revamp its economy and improve its rocky national finances , the international monetary fund has declared in its latest take on the world 's third-largest economy .
the imf added that weak demand and incomplete reform policies could lead to `` either stagnation or stagflation '' .

documents.title: mexico 's car industry revs up
text: the bbc 's katy watson has been peering under the bonnet ( or hood , if you prefer ) of mexico 's highly successful car industry .

documents.title: microsoft 'offered $ 55bn for salesforce '
text: microsoft and salesforce.com held `` significant talks '' earlier this year but could not agree on a price ,

documents.title: 'nothing new ' from yellen
text: i did n't think janet yellen had made any great revelations in her speech - and it appears robert van batenburg , director of market strategy at societe generale in new york , agrees .

`` yellen does n't say anything new it 's a very ambiguous set of comments that leaves us with no more clarity on the trajectory of the rate path for this year , and i think that 's what she wants to convey to the markets . ''

documents.title: more yellen
text: any decision to raise rates needed to be based on clear improvement in economic data , janet yellen said in her speech .
`` delaying action to tighten monetary policy until employment and inflation are already back to our objectives would risk overheating the economy . ''
however , the federal reserve chair also acknowledged problems such as disappointing wage growth and a significant number of people working part-time who would like full-time jobs .

documents.title: yellen 'expects to raise rates this year '
text: federal reserve chair janet yellen said she expected the central bank to raise rates this year as the us economy was on course to bounce back from a sluggish first quarter .

`` if the economy continues to improve as i expect , i think it will be appropriate at some point this year to take the initial step to raise the federal funds rate target , '' she said in a speech in rhode island .

documents.title: tech tent
text: is spotify 's revamp announced this week a brave leap - or a defence against apple 's forthcoming entry into the streaming music market ?
that 's one of the stories on this week 's tech tent presented by rory cellan-jones , with special guest cate sevilla , managing editor of buzzfeed uk .
download the podcast or listen

documents.title: oil prices slip
text: oil fell more than 1 % on friday as a stronger dollar and profit-taking ahead of the memorial day holiday weekend in the us ended a short rally .
us crude was down 95 cents at $ 59.77 a barrel , while

documents.title: altice eyes time warner cable
text: french telecommunications group altice is talking to several banks about raising debt for a potential bid for time warner cable , the second-largest u.s. cable operator , reuters reported .
time warner cable is also being courted by charter communications after comcast abandoned its $ 45bn offer for last month over regulatory concerns .

altice - which has already spent €36bn on acquisitions in the past 18 months - is said to be talking to banks including jpmorgan chase , nomura , bnp paribas , and barclays about a financing package to support a proposed swoop on time warner cable .

documents.title: vodafone pushes ftse higher
text: vodafone pushes ftse higher

documents.title: estonian pm 'understands cameron '
text: following the eu leaders ' summit in riga , estonian prime minister taavi rõivas tells the bbc 's susannah streeter : `` i understand david cameron 's concerns in respect of financial support for people coming to live in britain - the worry that some people might come mainly because of welfare , not to work or study we should discuss those concerns . ''
hear the full interview on
author: World Service

documents.title: uber loses french appeal
text: france 's highest court has rejected uber 's bid to have much of a recent law banning its services declared unconstitutional .
the conseil constitutionnel upheld most limits placed on uber-style services , including a ban on the ride-hailing app .
however , the court rejected fare restrictions that would have prevented uber 's drivers from charging by distance .
a spokesman for uber france said that was the most important part of the ruling for the company .

documents.title: yellen set for speech
text: federal reserve chair janet yellen is speaking at about 1800 london time about the prospects for the us economy .
she expected to say that better days should follow a temporary slowdown and highlight this year 's steady job growth .
that should keep the fed on track to raise rates later this year .

alan blinder , a former fed vice-chair and now economics professor at princeton university , said : `` i would n't be totally shocked if the fed [ raised rates by ] 25 basis points either in september or december , and then just held there for a while to see what happens . ''

documents.title: vimpelcom 's zimbabwe dilemma
text: the telecom company telecel hopes zimbabwe will stop trying to withdraw its mobile phone licence .
in business update on the world service , russell padmore explains how dutch firm vimpelcom owns 60 % of
author: World Service

documents.title: us consumer prices moderate
text: us consumer prices rose 0.1 % in april , compared with a 0.2 % increase in march , as fuel prices remained weak .
however , core cpi - which strips out food and energy costs - increased 0.3 % .
that was the biggest rise since january 2013 .

paul ashworth , chief economist at capital economics , said the figures gave the fed less scope to hold off on raising rates : `` september is still the most likely ( rate ) lift-off date , but july is not out of the question , particularly not if we get another couple of robust rises in core consumer prices in may and june . ''

documents.title: dutch government gets set to float abn amro
text: dutch bank abn amro , which was nationalised after the financial crisis , could start its return to private ownership this year .
dutch finance minister jeroen dijsselbloem said the first `` real chance '' of an ipo for the bank was in october or november , but that the offering could be delayed until 2016 .
the sale of a stake of up to 30 % could raise up to €4.5bn .

documents.title: wall street opens down
text: wall street opened lower for the last trading day of the week , with the dow jones down 26.9 points at 18,258.8 , while the s & p 500 fell 3.7 points to 2,127.1 , while the nasdaq was flat at 4,529 .
investors are hoping that a speech by federal reserve chairman janet yellen later will offer some insight into when the central bank will finally raise interest rates .
markets in new york and london are closed on monday for public holidays .

text: why is clarks spending millions to measure feet with ipads ?
click

we 've been to the london 3d print show to sort fact from fiction .

documents.title: good afternoon
text: thanks to tom and faarea for this morning 's coverage .
chris johnston here with you until 2130 with the rest of the day 's business news and views .

documents.title: via emaileiffel tower staff walkout over
text: in paris , the eiffel tower is closed to tourists today after staff walked out complaining about the growing number of operating on the monument .
they say that gangs of have become a regular presence , mingling with tourists as they move up the tower and stealing what they can .
every day there are several victims , particularly among asian visitors .
chinese tourists , of whom there are more and more in paris , are reputed to carry a lot of cash .
the tower 's management have apologised for the disruption and are working closely with paris police to improve security .
author: Hugh Schofield, BBC Paris correspondent

documents.title: eu agrees funds for ukraine
text: the european union has agreed to lend about $ 2bn ( £ 1.27bn ) to ukraine to revive the indebted country 's economy .
in return the ukrainian government has agreed to adopt a series of reforms , including measures to fight corruption .
the deal was signed today at a summit of eu leaders in latvia .

federica mogherini , the eu 's representative for foreign affairs said : `` we have increased and deepened our areas of co-operation in many fields for the benefits of our people both in the eu and in the partner countries . ''
author: World Service

documents.title: greece to cut bailout bank executive pay
text: greece is to cut the pay of its bailout bank fund 's executives by 40 % , because their salaries are a `` provocation '' during a time of austerity cuts , said the country 's finance ministry .
the hellenic financial stability fund ( hfsf ) , financed by the country 's bailout package , is the rescue vehicle that recapitalised greece 's big banks .

`` the minister ( yanis varoufakis ) understands that positions with high responsibility must be remunerated accordingly but salaries at the hfsf are a provocation for greek society when incomes in the private and public sectors have shrunk '' .
the pay cuts will need the approval of greece 's international lenders but the ministry added it `` expects no objections '' .

documents.title: eu commison president to talk about reforms with cameron
text: european commission president jean-claude juncker will travel to london on monday for talks with prime minister david cameron on british proposals for reform of the bloc , a british official said during an eu summit in latvia .

documents.title: via twitter
text: quality of uk jobs stalls for the first time .
a rarely reported indicator , but interesting nonetheless
author: Anthony Reuben
Head of statistics, BBC News

documents.title: cameron 'determined to deliver a reform of eu '
text: prime minister david cameron , who is laying the groundwork for uk eu membership negotiations during talks with eu leaders in latvia , said the process would have `` ups and downs '' .

he added : `` but one thing throughout all of this will be constant and that is my determination to deliver for the british people a reform of the eu so they get a proper choice in that referendum '' .

documents.title: brazil raises bank tax
text: the brazilian government has increased its tax on banks to lift revenues and curb its budget deficit .
in a decree by president dilma rousseff , the income tax has been raised from 15 % to 20 % .

documents.title: greece deal 'needs intensive work '
text: german chancellor angela merkel has said that a greece debt deal still requires `` very , very intensive work . ''

ms merkel and french president francois hollande spoke for about two hours with greek prime minister alexis tsipras at a summit in latvia as the three sought to pave the way for a deal to get greece more loans .
but mr tsipras said he was `` optimistic that we can soon reach a stable long-term and sustainable solution , without the mistakes of the past . ''

documents.title: 'prosecco shortage this summer '
text: like your italian fizz ?
prepare to pay a little more for prosecco this summer .

documents.title: aiib wants to be running by the end of the year
text: the china-backed

documents.title: french court decision hits uber
text: the french courts have upheld a ban on unlicensed taxis .
a paris appeals court had been waiting for the decision before ruling on whether to ban uber 's unlicensed taxi service , known as uberpop .
the case was brought by three competing car services and taxi unions .
uber is an app which allows drivers to use their private cars to offer rides at cheaper rates than traditional taxis .

documents.title: european outlook 'brighter but still has problems '
text: europe 's economy is faring better , but is not out of the woods yet , european central bank president mario draghi has told an economic forum in sintra , portugal .

`` the economic outlook for the euro area is brighter today than it has been for seven long years , '' he said , but added : `` this is by no means the end of our challenges , and a cyclical recovery alone does not solve all of europe 's problems . ''

documents.title: uk low housing loans rates 'crazy '
text: house prices across the uk have gone up nearly 10 % in the past year .
mortgage broker kerry rowling told
author: Radio 5 live

documents.title: public sector net borrowing shrinks
text: in the financial year ending april 2015 public sector net borrowing , excluding public sector banks - was £ 87.7bn - 4.8 % of gdp - a decrease of £ 10.8bn compared with the previous financial year .
but net debt was £ 1,487.7bn - 80.4 % of gdp , the office for national statistics said .

documents.title: uk government borrowing
text: uk government net borrowing was £ 6.8bn in april , a decrease of £ 2.5bn compared with april 2014 , the office for national statistics ( ons )

documents.title: business 'split over eu '
text: businesses tend to be split over eu membership , bbc economics editor robert peston tells business live .
multinational like the access to markets , but small businesses struggle with the costs of red tape , he says .

`` a large number of smaller businesses are very keen for the british prime minister to succeed in trying to get a bit of reform in europe so that there is less of a tendency to force regulations on businesses , '' he says .
on this particular point he may be going with the grain of european union thinking , robert adds .
author: Business Live

documents.title: inflation 'complicates ' union negotiations
text: after rail unions called off a potentially disruptive rail strike over the bank holiday weekend , professor roger seifert , a former advisor to industry mediator acas , told
author: Radio 5 live

documents.title: eu 'holding britain back '
text: eu membership `` does n't actually help us make trade agreements with other nations , '' says robert oulds , director of eurosceptic think tank bruges group .
`` it 's actually holding britain back .
britain has always been a globally trading nation with excellent links worldwide , '' he adds , saying agreements with countries such as china would be easier if the uk were to leave the eu .

documents.title: eu membership 'brings trade benefits '
text: having a new conservative government has brought the prospect of `` brexit '' - the uk leaving the eu - a step closer .
lucy thomas of pro-europe pressure group business for new europe says that brexit could jeopardise trade .

`` the eu is the largest market - there are 500 million consumers - so if you 're thinking about wanting to trade with people on our doorstep , where there 's one set of rules , we should carry on doing that with the eu , '' she says .
author: Business Live

documents.title: 'artificial hikes ' mean more expensive fuel
text: the aa 's latest fuel price report suggests the holiday for motorists could be over .
since february , the average cost for a litre of petrol has gone up by 10p .
edmund king , president of aa pins it to oil prices .

text: nationwide 's substantially increased statutory profit this year was mainly driven by the an `` improvement in net interest income '' ( the difference between what the building society earns on savings , and what it pays savers in interest ) which was up 19 % to £ 2.861bn .
reduced impairment losses , also played a part , which were down 34 % to £ 251m .
